title: A500ETF海富通（563860）跌0.81%，半日成交额4268.25万元|海富通_新浪财经_新浪网

author: LARA REVILLA
title: Valdecilla estrenará el lunes su primer quirófano híbrido, que combina cirugía con diagnóstico por imagen
text: 0 El primer quirófano híbrido del Hospital Universitario Marqués de Valdecilla de Santander, que combina “lo más puntero” de la cirugía con la tecnología “más innovadora” de diagnóstico por imagen, entrará en funcionamiento el próximo lunes. La principal novedad de este nuevo quirófano es que permite hacer, al mismo tiempo, pruebas diagnósticas y cirugías, ayudando a realizar aquellas más complejas de forma “rápida, fácil, segura y, también, menos invasiva”. En la práctica, se estima que podrán beneficiarse de este nuevo equipamiento “un gran número de pacientes”, ya que Valdecilla realiza al año más de 800 cirugías del sistema vascular y más de 1.500 radiologías vasculares. Además, cuenta con un brazo robotizado que permite realizar angiografías con imágenes de alta precisión, una tecnología especialmente beneficiosa para intervenir en patologías como el aneurisma de aorta abdominal y enfermedades vasculares de otros órganos, además de patologías no vasculares, fundamentalmente oncológicas y traumáticas. También permite atender en un solo procedimiento patologías urgentes que ahora se realizan en varios días. La presidenta de Cantabria, María José Sáenz de Buruaga, ha visitado este jueves el nuevo quirófano, denominado 'Doctor Andrés González Tutor', en recuerdo del doctor que hace 50 años puso en marcha el Servicio de Radiodiagnóstico en el hospital. “Hoy es un día importante para el sistema sanitario público, para la sanidad pública y para sus pacientes y profesionales”, ha trasladado Buruaga, que ha destacado que este quirófano supone “un gran avance en el campo de la cirugía, ya permite el trabajo conjunto de cirujanos y radiólogos intervencionistas”. En la visita a este quirófano, el número 33 del hospital público, la presidenta ha estado acompañada por el consejero de Salud, César Pascual; por la gerente del hospital, Dolores Acón; el jefe de Cirugía Cardiovascular, José Francisco Gutiérrez; y el jefe de Radiología del hospital, Andrés González Mandley. González Mandley ha considerado un “orgullo” ver cómo se incorporan nuevas tecnologías con el apoyo de las instituciones y el impulso de los trabajadores para mejorar el tratamiento de pacientes; y ha agradecido el que este quirófano lleve el nombre de su padre que, junto a los cirujanos cardiovasculares puso en marcha tecnologías híbridas en el hospital. El nuevo quirófano permite una mayor precisión intraoperatoria en las cirugías que se realizan a los pacientes ya que pueden obtener imágenes de una gran calidad en el mismo momento en el que se están realizando, lo que permite a los cirujanos comprobar la eficacia de la intervención antes de que finalice. Además, el complejo quirúrgico guiado por imagen aumenta la seguridad del paciente y no es necesario repetir pruebas ahorrando al paciente la administración de contrastes y la exposición a radiación, y facilita que cirujanos y radiólogos intervencionistas puedan trabajar de manera coordinada dentro del entorno quirúrgico. La puesta en marcha de este quirófano ha supuesto una inversión de 2,7 millones de euros, sumando el equipamiento y la obra que ha sido necesaria, y ha contado con la financiación europea de 800.000 euros con cargo al programa INVEAT.

author: @gurufocus
title: Chinese Firms Place $16 Billion Orders for Nvidia's H20 Server Chips
text:
Summary:
- Nvidia's (
NVDA,Financial) H20 server chips witness significant demand from Chinese tech giants, with orders exceeding $16 billion by early 2025. - Nvidia's revenue from China projected to reach $17.11 billion in fiscal 2025, despite trade restrictions.
- Analysts project a significant upside for Nvidia, with a potential increase of 141.08% based on GuruFocus estimates.
Chinese technology powerhouses such as ByteDance, Alibaba Group (BABA), and Tencent Holdings are showing significant interest in Nvidia's H20 server chips, placing orders totaling over $16 billion by early 2025. These cutting-edge chips, permitted under the current U.S. export guidelines, satisfy the surging demand, particularly from AI innovator DeepSeek. This move underscores Nvidia's strategic foothold in the competitive Chinese market.
The H20 chips, introduced following U.S. export restrictions in 2023, are instrumental in maintaining Nvidia's growth trajectory amidst escalating trade tensions. China remains a critical market for Nvidia, with contributions to revenue anticipated to reach $17.11 billion in fiscal 2025.
Nvidia's Prospects According to Wall Street Analysts
Wall Street remains optimistic about Nvidia Corp (NVDA, Financial) as evidenced by the one-year price targets from 53 analysts. The average target price is $171.00, with projections ranging from a high of $235.92 to a low of $75.40. This average target forecasts a potential 54.86% increase from the current price of $110.42. Investors can explore further details on the NVIDIA Corp (NVDA) Forecast page.
With an average brokerage recommendation of 1.7 from 64 firms, Nvidia Corp (NVDA, Financial) is currently rated as "Outperform." The rating spectrum spans from 1 (Strong Buy) to 5 (Sell), reflecting strong confidence in Nvidia's market potential.
According to GuruFocus metrics, the projected GF Value for Nvidia Corp (NVDA, Financial) in one year stands at $266.20, implying a remarkable 141.08% upside from the current price of $110.42. This GF Value is GuruFocus' estimate of the stock's fair trading value, determined by historical trading multiples, past growth, and future business performance projections. For a comprehensive data review, visit the NVIDIA Corp (NVDA) Summary page.

author: Elizabeth Hawthorne; At
title: A Closer Look at Medical Tourism: From Treatments to Market Dynamics
text:
In recent years, medical tourism has emerged as a transformative force in the global healthcare landscape, offering individuals the opportunity to access a diverse array of treatments, procedures, and wellness services beyond their home borders. This phenomenon encompasses a broad spectrum of healthcare options, ranging from elective surgeries and specialized treatments to wellness retreats and alternative medicine practices. In this comprehensive exploration, we delve into the intricacies of medical tourism, examining its various facets, market dynamics, and factors to consider when embarking on a healthcare journey abroad.
Understanding Medical Tourism: Beyond Borders
At its core, medical tourism involves individuals traveling outside their country of residence to seek medical treatment or wellness services. This movement transcends geographical boundaries, driven by factors such as cost-effectiveness, accessibility to specialized procedures, shorter wait times, and the allure of combining healthcare with leisure and tourism. Medical tourists often seek treatments ranging from cosmetic enhancements and dental procedures to complex surgeries, fertility treatments, and alternative medicine therapies.
The Evolution of Medical Tourism
Medical tourism has undergone significant evolution over the years, transitioning from a one-way flow of patients seeking advanced treatments in developed countries to a global phenomenon characterized by bidirectional movement and a multitude of destination choices. This evolution is fueled by advancements in healthcare technology, the rise of specialized medical facilities worldwide, and the increasing globalization of healthcare services. Today, medical tourism represents a multifaceted industry catering to diverse healthcare needs and preferences.
Treatments and Procedures: A Multifaceted Spectrum
The spectrum of treatments and procedures available through medical tourism is vast and varied, catering to a wide range of medical conditions and wellness goals. From routine medical check-ups and preventive screenings to complex surgeries and cutting-edge treatments, medical tourists have access to an extensive menu of healthcare options. Popular procedures include cosmetic surgery, dental treatments, orthopedic surgeries, cardiac procedures, fertility treatments, and wellness therapies such as spa retreats, yoga, and meditation.
Specialized Healthcare Services
One of the key attractions of medical tourism is access to specialized healthcare services that may not be readily available or affordable in the individual's home country. This includes treatments for rare medical conditions, experimental therapies, and procedures performed by leading experts in their respective fields. Medical tourists often seek out destinations known for their expertise in specific medical specialties, such as cancer treatment centers, fertility clinics, and cosmetic surgery hubs.
Market Dynamics: Navigating Choices and Considerations
The medical tourism market is influenced by a myriad of factors, including economic, geopolitical, cultural, and regulatory considerations. Understanding these dynamics is essential for both healthcare providers and medical tourists seeking to navigate the landscape effectively.
Destination Choices and Competitiveness
The choice of destination plays a crucial role in medical tourism, with countries vying to attract patients through competitive pricing, quality healthcare services, and tourism infrastructure. Popular medical tourism destinations often offer a combination of affordability, advanced medical technology, internationally accredited facilities, and a supportive regulatory environment. Factors such as travel logistics, language proficiency, cultural familiarity, and post-treatment care also influence destination preferences.
Healthcare Provider Selection
Selecting the right healthcare provider is paramount for a successful medical tourism experience. Patients should research and evaluate providers based on factors such as accreditation, reputation, medical expertise, patient reviews, and the availability of specialized treatments. Establishing clear communication channels, understanding treatment protocols, and ensuring continuity of care are essential considerations when choosing a healthcare provider abroad.
Cost Considerations and Financial Planning
While cost savings are a significant motivator for medical tourism, patients should approach financial considerations with careful planning and transparency. It is essential to factor in not only the upfront costs of treatment but also additional expenses such as travel, accommodation, pre- and post-operative care, and potential complications. Patients should seek transparent pricing, inclusive packages, and financial assistance options to mitigate unforeseen expenses and ensure a seamless healthcare journey.
Conclusion: Embracing Possibilities in Healthcare Exploration
Medical tourism represents a paradigm shift in how individuals approach healthcare, offering unprecedented opportunities for global exploration, wellness enhancement, and personalized care. By understanding the diverse treatments, market dynamics, and considerations involved in medical tourism, industry professionals and patients alike can make informed decisions, embark on transformative healthcare journeys, and discover new horizons in wellness and healing. As the medical tourism industry continues to evolve, the possibilities for accessible, affordable, and quality healthcare on a global scale are limitless, inviting individuals to embrace the journey toward health and well-being with optimism and confidence.
 Global
